name: Pride Asian Film Festival 2025
description:
Showcasing bold and boundary-pushing queer Asian cinema, featuring a powerful lineup of features, documentaries, and shorts that explore identity, love, and resistance. Films include Blossom Under Somewhere (a film about teenage girls' struggles), Yen and Ai-Lee (all about a mother-daughter relationship), Shunga: The Lost Japanese Erotica (a documentary of traditional Japanese erotic art), The Handmaiden: Extended Edition (this decade's classic about lesbian), and Queerpanorama. From intimate family stories to provocative visual art, PAFF celebrates diverse voices across Asia and the diaspora.
A Pride Affiliate event and not to be missed!

name: Open Jam with The Relay Jam
description:
Highly dynamic, this open format jam is fully backline and lead by the house band known as QB3D (Cubed). 

Alonzo "ZoMo" Moore, Marius Charlemagne, and Quincy Bullen work together to curate an experience for everyone on and off stage as they lead everyone through an improvised concert. Songs will be covers or originals, or a combination of the two but always encourages a fun and fresh approach to each performance. An exercise in professional musicianship but is always open to everyone. This jam will allow every musician to have a space for any genre, as long as it feels good!

name: Counterfits, H.O.C, the Readys' Rock n Roll Garage Sale
description: Jam out with three bands, and weird stuff for sale!

name: Nature Games Night for Adults and Older Teens

location.name: High Park Nature Centre Forest School

description:
Note: Pre-registration is required for all our events, hikes and workshops. We do this to ensure we don't exceed our capacity for indoor events or the maximum limits for group sizes on High Park's ecologically sensitive trails. 

Gear up for a game night that's as sustainable as it is competitive! Explore High Park with Jen Ball (Sticks, Stones & Pinecones) to collect natural game piecesâ€”pinecones, pebbles, and twigs. Then, head to OURSpace for a lively, eco-conscious game session where nature's materials fuel your strategy. This event offers a fun, mindful twist on board games. Perfect for teens and adults who love a challenge and want to play environmentally responsibly!

Age: 15+

name: Toronto Career Fair and Training Expo
description: Attention opportunity seekers! Back and better than ever, helping you advance your career in the right direction. Get in front of hiring managers, and network and apply to our recruiting exhibitors. Learn about exciting new career options and obtain valuable information about how to earn the credentials and diplomas you need to get the job you want with our training and career college exhibitors.

name: Finding Me: A Film by Brittnee Habbib
description: A 43 min dance film of navigating life through dark times... through trauma. It takes the audience through the journey of this young lady finding herself. To finding her joy. With no dialogue, each section has an introductory portion with spoken word to foreshadow what you'll be watching next.

name: Fashion Art Toronto's Spring/Summer 2025 Fashion Week
description:
The city's largest multi-arts fashion week Fashion Art Toronto's 1664 Fashion Week returns this Spring with a four-day event.

Experience the extraordinary on and off the runway including experiential designs, eco-friendly fashion, modern streetwear, extravagant evening wear, art installations, a massive boutique retailing local brands, a 1664 lounge and portrait studio, entertainment from DJs, musicians and dancers, a glamorous red carpet and more.

name: Harryetta Gardens Tree Planting Event
description:
Join us at Harryetta Gardens to plant native trees and shrubs and help increase Toronto's urban canopy. 

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: Dixonlicious 2025
description:
We are thrilled to announce the return of our annual culinary extravaganza in support of Dixon Hall's Food Programs!

It's an unforgettable evening filled with delectable delights, community spirit, and a shared commitment to making a difference. This year, more than 400 guests will sample mouth-watering cuisine from an array of diverse and creative food offerings, which are paired alongside a selection of craft beers, fine wines, and other beverages to complement every delicious bite.

Our goal this year is to provide 30,000 meals to those in need, and with your generous support, we know we can achieve it. Together, we can ensure that no one in our community goes hungry.

name: Live Podcast Event
description:
If political anxiety has felt like too much lately, you're not alone. Let's talk about it. 

Featuring co-hosts Asante Haughton and Kritika Sharda, joined by experienced panelists Walied Khogali Ali, Diana Yoon and Brennan Jackson. Our discussion will be focused on navigating the current political climate, non-stop barrage of news, and how people can take action and build emotional resilience in uncertain times.

name: Film Festival - Best of Black and White Shorts From Around the World

location.name: Carlton Cinemas - nearby College Subway Station

description: 85 minute program of films from the past year. Followed by talkback session with filmmakers in attendance. Please see website for full line-up of shorts.

name: The Best Comedy Show in Toronto in 80 Years
description:
A daytime and nighttime variety talk show experience. Think Comedy Bang Bang, Eric AndrÃ©, and anything you specifically like, it's all here!

Hosts Melanie Dahling and Laura McLean present sketch, stand-up, and improv from acts such as Double B (Blair MacMillan and Brendan Kane), Debit-Cash-Or-Credit (Emma Friedman, Mike Jankovich, Paul Smith), Sandwich (Chase Jeffels, Shaun Hunter, Brennan Asbridge, Antony Hall), Ben Stager, Gabe Meacher, Jim Temple, Conrad Osei...and more special guests!

name: Fashion on Fire
description:
Celebrate a night for inclusive and accessible fashion. Support the one in four women in Canada living with arthritis while enjoying canapÃ©s, a red hot runway show with models living with arthritis, and a pop-up shopping experience. Discover collections from top Canadian designers including David Dixon, Evolve Showrooms, Freda's, Gotstyle, and Joe Fresh. 

All proceeds support arthritis research and vital support programs. Fashion is for everyone, just like the right to live a healthy, fulfilling life.

name: Networking for Artists and Organizations - HAPPENING Multicultural Festival
description:
As part of HAPPENING Multicultural Festival 2025, this dynamic networking event invites newcomer, immigrant, and refugee artists to engage directly with arts and settlement organizations, youth-oriented programs, and a wide range of creative community partners.

This is your opportunity to:
- Discover resources and programs that support your artistic and personal journey
-  Build relationships with fellow artists and key community organizations
- Share your work, your vision, and your voice
- Connect with a growing creative community grounded in inclusion, care, and collaboration

Bonus: Registered participants are eligible to enter a raffle to win an all-expenses-paid spot in our 2026 International Artist Residency in Colombia!
